hikes.name: Appalachian Trail
hikes.start_finish: Springer Mountain, Georgia - Mount Katahdin, Maine
hikes.description: The Appalachian Trail is a 2,190-mile long public footpath that traverses the scenic, wooded, pastoral, wild, and culturally resonant lands of the Appalachian Mountains.

hikes.name: Pacific Crest Trail
hikes.start_finish: Campo, California - Manning Park, British Columbia, Canada
hikes.description: The Pacific Crest Trail (PCT) is a long-distance hiking and equestrian trail closely aligned with the highest portion of the Cascade and Sierra Nevada mountain ranges, which lie 100 to 150 miles east of the U.S. Pacific coast.

hikes.name: Continental Divide Trail
hikes.start_finish: Crazy Cook Monument, New Mexico - Waterton Lake, Montana
hikes.description: The Continental Divide Trail (CDT) is a United States National Scenic Trail running 3,100 miles between Mexico and Canada.

hikes.name: Arizona Trail
hikes.start_finish: Coronado National Memorial, Arizona - Utah-Arizona border near Fredonia, Arizona
hikes.description: The Arizona Trail is an 800-mile long-distance hiking trail located in Arizona, USA. It traverses the state from north to south, passing through diverse landscapes, including deserts, mountains, canyons, and forests.

hikes.name: Pacific Northwest Trail
hikes.start_finish: Chief Mountain Customs, Montana - Cape Alava, Washington
hikes.description: The Pacific Northwest Trail is a 1,200-mile long-distance hiking trail that spans from the Continental Divide in Montana to the Pacific Ocean in Washington State. It passes through the Rocky Mountains, Selkirk Mountains, Pasayten Wilderness, North Cascades, Olympic Mountains, and more.
